snippet: A state where gun ownership crosses political divides is becoming a test case for what kind of regulations can garner support.
abstract: Colorado is becoming national test case for what kind of gun regulations, if any, can gather support from lawmakers, law enforcement officials and public whose relationship with guns has been forged by tradition as much as tragedy; state is considering major gun control legislation for first time in decade.

byline.original: By JACK HEALY and DAN FROSCH

lead_paragraph: A state where gun ownership crosses political divides is becoming a test case for what kind of regulations can garner support.

headline.seo: Colorado a Crucible in National Gun Control Debate
headline.main: U.S. Debate on Gun Laws Is Put to a Test in Colorado
headline.print_headline: U.S. Debate On Gun Laws Is Put to a Test In Colorado
